title: Euler's theorem
summary: In number theory, Euler's theorem (also known as the Fermat–Euler theorem or Euler's totient theorem) states that, if n and a are coprime positive integers, and φ ( n ) {\displaystyle \varphi (n)} is Euler's totient function, then a raised to the power φ ( n ) {\displaystyle \varphi (n)} is congruent to 1 modulo n; that is
